‍GREASY.Definition: covered with or full of fat or oil

‍EXECUTING.Definition: killing someone as a legal punishment

‍BREAK TIES.Definition: finish a relationship, break up with

‍WIDOW.Definition: a woman whose husband or wife has died and who has not married again

‍HEIR.Definition: a person who will legally receive money, property, or a title from another person, especially an older member of the same family, when that other person dies

‍EYES SOON STARTED WANDERING.Definition: this means that Henry started looking for other relationships

‍FOND.Definition: to like someone or something very much; to like doing something

‍LADY IN WAITING.Definition: women whose job is to help a queen or other woman of high social position

‍HE HAD EYES FOR.Definition: that he wanted to start a relationship with

‍UNDONE.Definition: restored back to its previous state

‍CONSUMMATED.Definition: to make a marriage or romantic relationship complete by having sex

‍ASSURING.Definition: to tell someone confidently that something is true, especially so that they do not worry

‍ANNUL.Definition: to officially announce that something such as a law, agreement, or marriage no longer exists

‍AFFAIR.Definition: a sexual relationship, especially a secret one

‍ELUDING.Definition: if something that you want eludes you, you do not succeed in achieving it

‍MISCARRIAGES.Definition: an early, unintentional end to a pregnancy when the baby is born too early and dies because it has not developed enough

‍ADULTERY.Definition: sex between a married man or woman and someone he or she is not married to

‍TREASON.Definition: (the crime of) showing no loyalty to your country, especially by helping its enemies or trying to defeat its government

‍BEHEADED.Definition: to cut off someone's head, especially as a punishment

‍BACHELOR.Definition: a man who is not married

‍ALLIANCE.Definition: a group of countries, political parties, or people who have agreed to work together because of shared interests or aims

‍IN THE FLESH.Definition: in real life, and not on TV, in a film, in a picture, etc.

‍NICKNAMED.Definition: an informal name for someone or something, especially a name that you are called by your friends or family, usually based on your real name or your character

‍TERMS.Definition: the conditions that are part of an agreement or arrangement, or the features of an activity or idea

‍LOSE TRACK.Definition: to no longer know what is happening, or not to remember something

‍OBSESSED.Definition: unable to stop thinking about something; too interested in or worried about something

‍THORN.Definition: a small, sharp pointed growth on the stem of a plant

‍UNFAITHFUL.Definition: having a sexual relationship or experience with a person who is not your husband, wife, or usual sexual partner

‍COURT.Definition: the official home of a queen or king

‍NURSE.Definition: (verb) to care for a person or an animal while they are ill

‍SETTLED ON.Definition: to care for a person or an animal while they are ill

‍FAITHFUL.Definition: if your husband, wife, or partner is faithful, he or she does not have a sexual relationship with anyone else

‍CONFIDANT.Definition: a person you trust and share your feelings and secrets with

‍OUTLIVING.Definition: to live or exist longer than someone or something

‍RUTHLESS.Definition: not thinking or worrying about any pain caused to others ; cruel

‍THANKLESS.Definition: a thankless job is difficult or unpleasant, and people do not thank you for it
